definition: to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
lit. fish and dragons mixed in together (idiom); fig. crooks mixed in with the honest folk
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags

pinyin: she2 lu:4 hun4 za2 yan2 dai4

sentences.english: In Covent Garden? Well, it's big for like, well, it's all mixed, really.
sentences.chinese: 科芬园？它很大，也很混杂，真的。

sentences.english: His worship and religion will endure neither mixture, nor partner.
sentences.chinese: 他的崇奉和宗教便决不容有混杂和伴侣。

sentences.english: The projects are a mixture of legacy and new code.
sentences.chinese: 这些项目混杂着遗留代码和新写代码。

sentences.english: A word that serves as a catchall for a bewildering array of computer accessories.
sentences.chinese: 一个可作为混杂排列的计算机附件的统称词。

sentences.english: A tint is the hue mixed with white.
sentences.chinese: 淡色是纯色与白色混杂后的成果。

sentences.english: The small ocean basin is formed and the ophiolite appear when back arc basin expands.
sentences.chinese: 弧后盆地扩张到达小洋盆，出现蛇绿混杂岩。

sentences.english: Granted that a catalog is by its very nature a mélange.
sentences.chinese: 诚然，一份目录，就其本质来说便应当是混杂的。

sentences.english: On the economy, our record was mixed.
sentences.chinese: 经济上，我们的记录有些混杂。

sentences.english: The backs of their ears, head and legs are often tinged with a reddish color.
sentences.chinese: 在它们耳朵，眼睛和腿的后面往往混杂着略微的红色。

sentences.english: To be sure, hybridity poses risks.
sentences.chinese: 当然，混杂状态是有风险的。

sentences.english: Such as wiretapping mode called "sniffer base on intermix mode".
sentences.chinese: 这种窃听方式为“基于混杂模式的嗅探”。

sentences.english: The Wenzhou shoe market and factory complex takes up several city blocks.
sentences.chinese: 温州鞋类交易市场和制造工厂混杂在城市的一些街区。

sentences.english: Prospective studies have variably adjusted for relevant confounders and have been of relatively limited duration.
sentences.chinese: 前瞻性研究调整了相关混杂性设计和限制了持续时间。

sentences.english: Historically, there has been a lot of deep-seated prejudice against ethnically mixed people.
sentences.chinese: 历史上，对种族混杂的人有许多根深蒂固的种族偏见。

sentences.english: Non-Smith stratum, Zhanggongshan groups did not exist in Shuangqiaoshan group.
sentences.chinese: 非史密斯地层仅发育于江南混杂岩带中。

sentences.english: How is one a precept-breaking mixed-up priest?
sentences.chinese: 如何是一个人破坏戒律的混杂教士？

definition: to mix together (disparate substances)/to mingle/a mix/to be tangled up with
to be full of/to flood/to congest
mix together/put together (usu. things that do not blend well together)
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
mixed cropping (i.e. growing two crops together)
to dissipate everywhere (of light, sound, gas etc)
